answers.answer: It sounds like you have multiple symptoms going on.  What does your doctor say?  You might want to detox and get on food-based vitamins/minerals.  Start taking probiotics (available in refrigerator section in health food store).  While your there, get some pH test strips to see how acidic your body is.  Stay away from sugar.  If you have a yeast problem, sugar feeds it.  Honey is a good substitute.  NO POP!  Stop breads.  Bread has yeast. Don't eat anything with MSG.  No red meats for a while. No lunch meat..it has sodium nitrates in them.  Have your doctor check for Hpylori.  Eat a lot of fresh fruits/vegetable and drink lots of spring water.  Hope this helps!

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!You could be suffering from an inflammatory bowel condition such as Celiac Disease/Ulcerative Colitis/Irritable Bowel Syndrome/ Crohn’s disease. Parasites in the gut like threadworm, tape worm, giardiasis etc can behave this way. Hence a stool test is a must. Problems of gall bladder and liver or that of pancreas too cannot be ignored. Possibility of H pylori infection should be looked into by carbon urea breath test. Since ESR is almost normal, chances of any of these conditions are less except for acidity and H pylori infection but worth a try.Extreme fatigue could be due to anemia, diabetes, hypothyroidism, or due to kidney or liver problems. Another possibility is sleep disturbances (like sleep apnea, imbalance of rapid eye and non rapid eye movement sleep etc.). You may sleep your customary 7-8 hours and yet feel fatigued. You need sleep studies to rule this out. Other possibilities are chronic fatigue syndrome, depression, low Vit b12, low iron, low calcium, sodium and potassium. Hyperthyroidism too causes increased sweating and tiredness.   A comprehensive investigation is required keeping all the points in mind. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Take care!
